Welcome to HTML

Lets get down to basics

Hyper Text Mark Up Language (or better known at HTML) is the structure to any good website. Thnk of it as the bones of the website, it's the skeleton that puts everything into place. It's also the start of your journey into becoming a great Web Developer. The best way to learn is by doing so lets dive into some code!

The !Doctype

All good things start here

All HTML documents must start with a !DOCTYPE declaration. The `DOCTYPE` tag is a document type declaration (DTD) that tells a browser about the version of HTML used in a document.

Below is a snippet of the first 4 lines of any HTML document. These 4 lines are all the information a Browser needs to understand what your document is trying to render.

Here's a quick explination of what you're looking at, then lets get to some coding:

  • Below the doctype is the html lang, this tells the browswer what langugae the document is in, in this case, its English.
  • Third tag is in our first meta tag, we'll dig deeper into meta tags later but for now understand it's a snippet of code that describes the web page's content.UTF-8 stands for 8-bit Unicode Transformation Format. It's a character set that includes almost all known characters, punctuations, and symbols.
  • Finally the last meta tag you see there is the viewport meta tag, it is used to set the width and scaling of a viewport so that it's correctly sized on all devices, particularly mobile devices.

Learn By Doing

These lessons are important, but the best way to learn is to code along with the lessons. We reccomend VS code but if you'd like to work along in your browser here are some great alternatives:

  • Replit
  • Stackblitz
  • Codepen
